page.title: 06GREETE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
page.content: Greete W.I. was formed in 1952. Meetings are held on the second Wednesday of each month,alternately at Nash and Greete Village Halls(see page 5).There are 17 members. Annual meeting is in November when President and Committee are elected. Annual subscription is Â£4. Current President is Mrs.Nancy Wozencroft who has lived in the area about 40 years. Greete W.I. members are very community minded, organising the social car scheme,supporting local charities including Tenbury Hospital and visiting housebound old people. The varied programme of speakers is planned a year in advance and outings to places of interest are organised. Ludlow South Group comprises Greete,Knowbury,Bitterly,Caynham & Ashford, Richard's Castle and Ludlow (newly formed) Women's Institutes.
